headline: Charles Schwab Earnings Miss Estimates. The Stock Is Rising Anyway.
summary: Charles Schwab  shares rose on Wednesday after the financial services company reported fourth-quarter earnings that slightly missed Wall Street’s expectations.  Despite that shortfall, the results showed strong growth in earnings, revenue, and net new assets, as Schwab benefited from a surge in investor activity that creates a tailwind for the company in 2026.  On Wednesday, Schwab posted adjusted fourth-quarter earnings of $1.39 per share, a penny short of the FactSet analyst consensus for $1.40.

headline: Charles Schwab’s Q4 results meet expectations but shares fall
summary: Investing.com -- Charles Schwab Corporation (NYSE:SCHW) reported fourth-quarter earnings that matched analyst expectations, with shares falling 3% as investors reacted to the in-line results despite record revenue performance.

headline: Charles Schwab Earnings Are Lower Than Expected. The Stock Is Down.
summary: A surge in investor activity boosted  Charles Schwab  profits in 2025, but the company’s fourth-quarter results fell just a tad short of Wall Street expectations.  The company posted adjusted fourth-quarter earnings of $1.39 per share, a penny short of Wall Street analysts’ expectations that it would report adjusted earnings of $1.40 per share.  Fourth-quarter revenue came in at $6.34 billion compared to analyst projections for $6.38 billion, according to estimates compiled by FactSet.

headline: Charles Schwab Earnings Lower Than Expected. The Stock Is Down.
summary: Charles Schwab  posted adjusted fourth-quarter earnings of $1.39 per share, falling a penny short of Wall Street analysts’ expectations that it would report adjusted earnings of $1.40 per share.  Fourth-quarter revenue came in at $6.34 billion compared to analyst expectations of $6.38 billion, according to estimates compiled by FactSet.  Shares of Schwab were down about 3% in premarket trading Wednesday morning.

headline: Charles Schwab (NYSE:SCHW) Misses Q4 CY2025 Revenue Estimates
summary: Financial services giant Charles Schwab (NYSE:SCHW) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales rose 18.9% year on year to $6.34 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.39 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Trump in Davos, SCOTUS hearing, J&J earnings: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, January 21, including President Trump's speech at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, the US Supreme Court (SCOTUS) hearing on whether the administration has the ability to fire Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook, US pending homes sales, and quarterly earnings reports from companies like Johnson & Johnson (JNJ), Charles Schwab (SCHW), and Haliburton (HAL). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
